The claim originated from an article pub: which has been archived and has received over 9,000 interactions on Facebook.
The article states that Michael Olunga: a Kenyan football player, was offered £600 million (not euros) to renounce his Kenyan citizenship for Japan.
The claim was widely shared on social me: including by Kenyan comedian Churchill, who has a large following.
A spokesperson for Olunga: s team, Kashiwa Reysol, denied that any offer of Japanese citizenship or money had been made to the player. Additionally, FIFA regulations prevent Olunga from playing for Japan's national team due to his previous participation in official matches for Kenya.
